sdp_rule.name: OS Certified?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT,$OS_ARC if match($OS_ARC,'sparc',true) {call setHcveResult(check(\ $OS_VER,'^2\.(5\.1|6|7)$',\ concat('Solaris ',$OS_VER,\ ' is not certified with Oracle Database 10g'),\ '^2\.([89]|10)$',\ cond(expr('==',$OS_BIT,32),concat(\ '10g is not certified for 32bit Solaris ',$OS_VER),\ 'Certified with Oracle Database 10g'),\ concat($OS_NAM,' OS version not determined'))) } else {call setHcveResult(check(\ $OS_VER,'^2\.(5\.1|6|7|8|9)$',\ concat('Solaris ',$OS_VER,\ ' is not certified with Oracle Database 10g'),\ '^2\.10$',\ 'Certified with Oracle Database 10g',\ concat($OS_NAM,' OS version not determined'))) }
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the correct version of Solaris required for installing Oracle Database 10g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct version of Solaris is installed on your server.

!!SHOWSTOPPER!! You do not have the correct version of Solaris installed on your server. For the certified versions of Solaris, see the ''Oracle Database 10g Installation Guide for Solaris'' and My Oracle Support.

sdp_rule.name: User in /etc/passwd?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/passwd')),\ 'Can not read /etc/passwd',\ grepFile('/etc/passwd',\ concat('^',$usr = first(command('/usr/xpg4/bin/id -nu')),':'),\ 'f'),\ 'userOK',\ concat($usr,' not in /etc/passwd.')))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user name of the user who runs this script is in the ``/etc/passwd`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/passwd`` file contains the user. No action is required.
The ``/etc/passwd`` file does not contain the user or else the file has no read permissions. Add the user to the ``/etc/passwd`` file if the user does not exist in the file.

sdp_rule.name: Group in /etc/group?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/group')),\ 'Can not read /etc/group',\ grepFile('/etc/group',concat('^',command('/usr/xpg4/bin/id -ng'),':'),'f'),\ 'GroupOK',\ 'Group not in /etc/group'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the group to which the user belongs exists in the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/group`` file contains the group of the user. No action required.
ALERT: The ``/etc/group`` file does not contain the group of the user. Add the group to the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_rule.name: Umask Set to 022?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ expr('==','022',command('/usr/bin/umask')),'UmaskOK','UmaskNotOK'))

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH_64`` environment variable is not set. No action required.

sdp_rule.name: Other O_Hs in PATH?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the PATH variable does not contain any references to other Oracle home directories based on the ``/var/opt/oracle/oratab`` entries.

sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('f','/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc')),\ 'oraInventoryNotFound',\ not(testFile('wr',$INV_LOC = \ value(grepFile('/var/opt/oracle/oraInst.loc','^inventory_loc','f')))),\ 'oraInventoryNotOK',\ 'oraInventoryOK')) call setHcveVariable('$INV_LOC')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user installing Oracle Database 10g has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory.

In this case, the installer creates the ``oraInventory`` directory. No action required.

The user, who is logged in, cannot access (write and read) ``oraInventory`` while installing Oracle Database 10g . sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,$OS_BIT var @tbl = () macro check_package {var (\@tbl,$pkg) = @arg call loadCommand('/usr/bin/pkginfo') var @pkg = ('arc','btool','hea','libC',\ 'libm','libms','mfrun','sprot',\ 'too','xwfnt','i1cs','i15cs',\ 'i1of','uiu8','ulcf','xcu4',$pkg) loop $pkg (split('\s',concat('SUNW',join(' SUNW',@pkg)))) {if not(grepLastFile($pkg,'f')) call push(@tbl,$pkg) } } call check(\ $OS_VER,'^2\.10$', check_package(\@tbl),\ check_package(\@tbl,'sprox')) if expr('==',$OS_BIT,32) call push(@tbl,\ 'OS is not showing as running as 64bit bit, investigate') call setHcveResult(cond(\ scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),'All required OS packages are installed'))

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Sun Cluster status test was completed. If you do not have a Sun Cluster, then this test does not apply. Otherwise, a cluster was detected and is running. No action is required.

Because a cluster has been detected or partially detected during a Typical Installation, the RAC option is installed automatically. This causes problems. Oracle recommends using the Custom Install and deselecting the RAC option to avoid any problems.| |TestCompleted|If you do not have a Sun Cluster, then this test does not apply. Otherwise, a cluster was detected and is up. No action is required.|
